item.title: 文献笔记-大脑功能网络中体现的左右半球和性别差异
item.description: Title Hemisphere- and gender-related differences in small-world brain networks: A resting-state functional MRI study Results Male have a large normalized clustering coefficient in the right hemispheric network, but a lower clustering coefficient in the left hemispheric network. Significant hemisphere-related differences in the regional nodal characteristics: frontal and occipital regions (leftward asymmetry), temporal regions (rightward asymmetry). Conclustions Topological organization of human brain functional networks is associated with gender and hemispheres.
